subject: Business
title: Inflation: The Silent Thief
description: A quick win: understand Inflation: The Silent Thief.

hook.text: In 1980, a movie ticket cost $2.69. Today it costs $11. Your salary may have grown. Your purchasing power may not have.

buildup.text: Inflation is the general increase in prices over time, reducing the purchasing power of each dollar.

discovery.text: Central banks target about 2% inflation per year. At that rate, prices double every 36 years.

twist.text: Keeping cash under a mattress loses value every year. Savings accounts below the inflation rate also lose value.

climax.text: Venezuela's hyperinflation hit 1,000,000% in 2018. A cup of coffee cost more in the afternoon than the morning.

punchline.text: Money in your pocket is money losing value. Invest it or inflation takes it.

quiz.question: At 2% annual inflation, how long does it take for prices to double?
